div1.p: Blue instructs Carter to assist power company officials.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, March 17, 1916
div1.opener:
JKB
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WMT
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
March 17, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
In reply to your letter of the 13th instant, rel-
ative to your status while visiting Augusta, Georgia,
in accordance with information furnished you in Bureau
telegrams of March 4th and 6th, and telephone communi-
cation, you are informed that the Department desires
that you assist the Power Company in any legitimate
manner possible, on the request of Ex-Governor Mann
of Virginia, attorney for the Company, who stated that
the Power Company would pay your expenses. Your
absence from your station will not be charged to your
annual leave.
